name: Re-authentication
description: Require users to re-authenticate when [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring re-authentication].
supplemental_guidance: In addition to the re-authentication requirements associated with device locks, organizations may require re-authentication of individuals in certain situations, including when roles, authenticators or credentials change, when security categories of systems change, when the execution of privileged functions occurs, after a fixed time period, or periodically.

attack_techniques.name: Brute Force
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Mandatory re-authentication after failed attempts forces adversaries to restart brute force campaigns from scratch, significantly increasing the time and effort required for credential compromise.

attack_techniques.name: Password Guessing
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Re-authentication requirements with progressive lockout after failed attempts directly counter password guessing by limiting the number of authentication attempts within each session window.

attack_techniques.name: Password Cracking
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Mandatory re-authentication with fresh challenge-response mechanisms prevents adversaries from replaying cracked credentials, since re-authentication requires current session context validation.

attack_techniques.name: Password Spraying
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Re-authentication requirements with session-specific lockout counter password spraying by limiting per-session attempts, preventing adversaries from distributing guesses across accounts without triggering lockout.

attack_techniques.name: Credential Stuffing
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Mandatory re-authentication with rate limiting on new sessions counters credential stuffing by throttling the speed at which adversaries can test harvested credential pairs across authentication endpoints.

attack_techniques.name: Multi-Factor Authentication
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Re-authentication requirements that enforce fresh MFA challenges prevent adversaries who have compromised the MFA pipeline from maintaining persistent access through modified authentication flows.

attack_techniques.name: Hybrid Identity
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Re-authentication across hybrid identity systems forces validation against both on-premises and cloud identity providers, detecting adversaries who have compromised only one side of the hybrid identity chain.
